variant.question:
An aircraft is departing from departure point A 25°N, 175°W on the 7th January at 14:23 LMT. Given the following information, calculate the time (standard time) and date of arrival at B STB.
 
Difference UTC and STA: 11 hours 
Destination point B: 15°N, 155°E 
Difference between UTC and STB: 10 hours 
Distance along the great circle between A and B: 1790 NM 
Average head wind component: 19 kt 
Average TAS: 400 kt
What is the meaning of the term 'standard time'?

options.text: It is the time set by the legal authorities for a (part of a) country.
It is another term for UTC.
It is an expression for Local Mean Time.
It is the time zone system and is applicable only in the Unites States of America.

variant.question: Consider the following statements on 'departure'

options.text: as the latitude increases, the departure between two meridians decreases.
departure is independent of difference of longitude.
as the difference of longitude increases, the departure is constant if the latitude is constant.
departure may be calculated using the equation: departure=Sin Lat. x sin Long.

variant.question: Standard time is

options.text: the time enforced by the legal authority to be used in a country or an area.
the time used at a particular meridian.
the time which is accepted and used as a standard for the whole world.
the time most frequently used for air navigation.

variant.question: Daylight Saving Time (Summer Time)

options.text: is introduced by setting the standard time forward by one hour.
is used to extend the sunlight period in the evening.

variant.question:
Departure A 25° N 175° W on 7th January at 1423 LMT. 
Difference UTC and ST (at A) is 11 hours. 
Destination B 15° N 155° E. Difference UTC and ST (at B) is 10 hours. 
The distance along great circle between A and B is 1 790 NM. 
Average headwind component is 19 kt, average TAS is 400 kt.
Calculate standard time (ST) and date of arrival at B

On the 4th February at 08:00 Standard Time A STA an aircraft is exactly above position A. Given the following information, estimate the time and date of arrival at position B in Standard Time B STB

Position A: 50°00.0’N, 138°30.0’W STA: UTC -9 hoursPosition B: 50°00.0’N, 175°45.0’ E STB: UTC +12 hoursGround distance between A and B: 1736 NMAir distance between A and B exactly when the aircraft arrives over position B: 1636 NMAverage tailwind component for the flight: 25 kt
Some states implement daylight saving time (sometimes referred to as summer time) by advancing the clocks 1 hour in spring. Which of the following options is an effect of this?

options.text: The daylight is shifted towards later in the day.
The daylight is shifted towards earlier in the day.
There is 1 hour of reduced daylight per day.
There is 1 hour of additional daylight per day.

variant.question: When the time is 20:00 UTC, it is

Refer to figure. 
 An aircraft leaves New York, USA, for Hawaii, USA, on the 21st of July, 2018, at 21:20 Standard Time (ST). Assume that the Daylight Saving Time (DST) applies, except for Hawaii. The flight time is 12 hours 50 minutes. What will be the Standard Time and date of arrival at Hawaii?

An aircraft is flying on a westerly heading and crossing the international date line. It has to cover 15° of longitude to reach its destination aerodrome; its flight time will be equal to 2 hours. What is the ST of arrival when it departs on April 8th at **1200** ST?
When crossing the International Date Line from the West (flying in an easterly direction), you:

options.text: should be prepared to gain one day.
should be prepared to lose one day.
should not change date at the first midnight you experience.
should increase your date by an extra date at the first midnight you experience.

variant.question: Where is the International Dateline located?

options.text: In the vicinity of the 180°E/W meridian.
To the west of the 180°E/W meridian only.
To the east of the 180°E/W meridian only.

variant.question: During the summer months, some states apply daylight savings. What does this mean?

options.text: In the afternoon/evening, an hour of daylight is gained.
In the afternoon/evening, an hour of daylight is lost.

variant.question: Which of the following alternatives is correct when you cross the international date line?

options.text: The date will increase if you are crossing on a westerly heading.
If you are crossing from westerly longitude to easterly longitude the date will remain the same.
The date will increase if you are crossing on a easterly heading.
The date will always be the same.

An aircraft takes off from Guam at 2300 Standard Time on 30 April local date. After a flight of 11 HR 15 MIN it lands at Los Angeles (California). What is the Standard Time and local date of arrival (assume summer time).

ST in country A is UTC + 13 hours
ST in country B is UTC - 11 hours.
Daylight saving times (ST +1 hour) is kept in country B from March to October.

The difference in longitude between A and B is 15º and the flight time is 1 hour. If the aircraft departed at **1200** LMT on the 5^th^ of August, what is the date and time (LMT) of arrival at B?
You are crossing the International Date Line on an eastbound direction during the sunlight period on the 10^th^ of a month. Which date is it at your destination?

Refer to figures 061-07 and 061-08.
When it is 12:30 Standard Time in Queensland (Australia) the Standard Time in Hawaii (USA) is:

 If the Standard Time (ST) in Queensland, Australia, is 12:00 on the 10th of July, what is the Standard Time in Hawaii, USA?
Standard time for some areas is listed in the Air Almanac as UTC +13 instead of UTC -11. The reason for this is:

options.text: keeping the same date as the political and or economical entity to which they belong.
the setup of the sunrise/sunset tables.
the fact that they are keeping daylight saving time.

 Standard time in country B is UTC -7 hours.

- Flight time:      1 hour
- Change of longitude between A and B: 15 degrees
- Track direction:  West
- Departure time and date from A:  12:00 LMT, 5th August

Determine the Standard Time (ST) and date of arrival in Chile, given the following information: 
  
 Route: New Zealand to Chile, crossing the international date line on an easterly course 
 Departure time and date: 03:00 UTC, 19th November 
 Flight time: 12 hours 30 minutes 
 New Zealand ST: UTC + 12 hours 
 Chile ST: UTC - 4 hours

An airline company has its headquarters at Schiphol (UTC+2h). An aircraft takes off from Quito at 4th September ST 22:30 (UTC-5h) and flies to Lagos (UTC+3h). Flight time is 11:14. What is the ST at the headquarters at the time of arrival of the aircraft?

You depart from the western hemisphere, flying along the equator to the eastern hemisphere, crossing the date line on a westerly heading. The difference between your location and the destination is 15° of longitude. You depart on the 14^th^ of August at 12:00 LMT. Assuming you are travelling at an average ground speed of 300 kt, what is the ETA at the destination?

An aircraft departs from Schiphol airport and flies to Santa Cruz in Bolivia (South America) via Miami in Florida. The departure time (off blocks) is 07:45 ST on the 10th of November, and taxi time before take off at Schiphol is 25 minutes. The flight time to Miami over the Atlantic Ocean is 09h 20m. The total taxi time in Miami to and from the gate is 25 minutes. The time spend at the gate is 02h 40m. From Miami to Santa Cruz the airborne time is 06h 30m.

Calculate the time and date of touch down in Santa Cruz in ST Bolivia if the difference between ST and UTC is 5 hours.

What is the standard time (ST) and date at position A if the standard time at position B is 15:00 on the 15^th^ of July?


- ST at A:  UTC-4
- ST at B:  UTC+7
When it is 1000 Standard Time in Kuwait, the Standard Time in Algeria is
Which statement about standard time is true?

options.text: Standard time is determined by the government of the appropriate state and does not necessarily follow the borders of 15°wide longitude zones.
Standard time is the time that is determined by division of the longitude by 15 and rounding off the answer to the nearest integer.
In all cases the standard times at western longitudes are earlier than UTC and at eastern longitudes later than UTC.
The standard time at 125°W is UTC 8h 20m.

The headquarters (HQ) of an airline is located at Schiphol, Netherlands (52°19'N, 004°46'E, UTC +2 hours). One of its aircraft departs from Quito, Ecuador (00°08'S, 078°21'W, UTC- 5 hours) at 22:30 ST on the 26th August local date and flies to Nairobi, Kenya (01°19'S, 036°56′E, UTC + 3 hours). The flight time is 11 hours 14 minutes. What is the Standard Time (ST) and local date at the airline HQ when the aircraft arrives at its destination?

The headquarters (HQ) of an airline is located at Schiphol, the Netherlands (52°19'N, 004°46'E, UTC +2 hours).
One of its aircraft departs from Quito, Ecuador (00°08'S, 078°21'W, UTC- 5 hours) at 22:30 ST on the 26th August local date to Nairobi, Kenya (01°19'S, 036°56′E, UTC + 3 hours).
The flight time is 11 hours 14 minutes. What is the Standard Time (ST) and local date at the airline HQ when the aircraft arrives at its destination?
